item.title: Upcoming Games Like No Man's Sky
item.description:
Since its ambitious debut, No Man’s Sky has become synonymous with boundless exploration, survival, and discovery across the stars. Its unmatched level of freedom reshaped expectations for spacefaring adventures, yet as the genre matures, a new wave of games is preparing to push those ideas further, offering their own interpretations of infinite skies and uncharted frontiers.

From narrative-driven journeys to hard science fiction simulators, numerous upcoming titles aim to explore various aspects of what makes space so alluring. Vast galaxies, mysterious planets, interstellar travel, and survival against the odds remain at their core, ensuring the next generation of space exploration games will be as ambitious as they are imaginative.

SpaceCraft

From Automation To Planetary Exploration

SpaceCraft
Adventure
Simulation
Systems
Released
2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Shiro Games
Powered by

Set in the aftermath of humanity’s desperate escape from war machines known as the Tripods, SpaceCraf t offers a vast galaxy to explore and rebuild within. Players freely traverse star systems, asteroid belts, derelict ships, and planetary surfaces, scanning for resources and uncovering the remnants of lost civilizations.

Every discovery fuels survival, as mined materials can be crafted into advanced components and starship parts, or traded across a dynamic player-driven economy. Beyond exploration, players construct automated outposts and defend themselves from roaming pirates, giving them a true sense of purpose in a galaxy full of ruin and decay.

Light No Fire

A World Even Larger Than Before

Light No Fire
Adventure
Survival
Open-World
RPG
Action
Sandbox
Fantasy
Systems
Developer(s)
Hello Games

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

From Hello Games, the studio behind No Man’s Sky , comes Light No Fire , an ambitious fantasy adventure set on a single, procedurally generated planet the size of Earth. Unlike the developer's previous survival game, the focus is not on galaxies but on the richness of one vast, living world where players can climb mountains, cross oceans, and traverse continents in a seamless, shared space brimming with life.

The game blends survival mechanics with cooperative freedom, encouraging exploration as a group rather than a solitary mission. Mounts, sailing vessels, and airships expand mobility, giving players more options to traverse the world, and by merging the infinite possibilities of procedural design with a more grounded, Earth-like scale, players will never run out of things to see and do.

Falling Frontier

Strategy Among The Stars

  • Release Date : Coming Soon
  • Developer : Stutter Fox Studios

Falling Frontier reshapes the real-time strategy genre with a hard sci-fi focus on reconnaissance, logistics, and ship design. Set in a procedurally generated star system, players establish orbital shipyards, supply depots, and colonies while competing against rival human factions for resources and territory.

The combat balances cinematic spectacle with tactical nuance, as shots ricochet, subsystems fail under fire, and ambushes allow nimble ships to overcome heavy cruisers. The emphasis is for sure on agency, as players are given all the tools they need to wield entire fleets however they choose, all within a universe that seems to have no end.

For The Stars

The Next Big Space Exploration Hit

  • Release Date : Coming Soon
  • Developer : Snail Games USA

For the Stars invites players to explore a vast galaxy filled with diverse planets, strange alien ruins, and rare resources. Each world players encounter has unique ecosystems and challenges that range from environmental hazards to hostile creatures, forcing them to adapt to their surroundings every time they touch down.

Customization truly is king here, with everything from ship to player model appearances being fully customizable to the player's tastes and desires. With so much to do and see, few space games on the horizon can compete with the level of scale and depth offered by For The Stars .

Haunted Space

Cosmic Horror Brought To Life

  • Release Date : Coming Soon
  • Developer : Italian Games Factory

Haunted Space combines deep space simulation with a horror-infused narrative, pitting players against colossal Lovecraftian creatures scattered across multiple star systems. The universe is filled with ancient, godlike entities composed of organic matter and debris, each presenting multi-stage, high-stakes encounters.

Players have lots of options in terms of their space adventures, as ships can be crafted, upgraded, and tailored for specific missions, while the innovative co-pilot system allows seamless control ranging from full simulation to arcade-style play. The system also supports accessibility features, including eye-tracking, ensuring that the horror and challenge of the void can be experienced by a wide audience.

Breathedge 2

Blending The Past And The Future

  • Release Date : Q1 2026
  • Developer : RedRuins Softworks

Breathedge 2 continues the ironic, retro-futuristic saga of The Man, navigating intergalactic crises alongside a crew of unique companions. Players explore multiple planetary clusters, each with distinct zones, colorful environments, and hazards ranging from unique wildlife to floating debris.

Each crew member plays a vital role in the success of the adventure, but they also require a good amount of attention and care to make the most of their individual talents. This creates a unique gameplay loop where players have to constantly consider the wider group rather than themselves as a solo captain.

Inter Solar 83

Sending You Back To The 80s

  • Release Date : To be announced
  • Developer : First Time Games

Inter Solar 83 is a uniquely stylized VR game that sends players across the stars to explore the unknown. The main draw comes from the visuals, taking inspiration from classic technology and 8-bit PCs to deliver an experience that looks and feels unlike anything else.

Players need to manage plenty of different systems on their trips, seeking out resources to fuel their desire to make the next jump. With the entire experience being playable in VR, players will have a blast being fully immersed in this charming yet enticing universe.

item.title: How Mosquito Could Fit into Death Stranding’s Post-Apocalyptic World
item.description:
The following contains mild spoilers for Death Stranding .

Announced at the Kojima Productions 10th Anniversary event, dubbed Beyond the Strand, Death Stranding Mosquito is the Death Stranding franchise’s enigmatic foray into anime/animation. Produced by Death Stranding ’s Hideo Kojima, directed by ABC Animation’s Hiroshi Miyamoto, and written by Raised by Wolves and Prisoners ’ Aaron Guzikowski, Mosquito is reportedly only a working title for the animation film project thus far. Nevertheless, with Death Stranding and Kojima’s work rarely bothering with subtlety regarding people’s names and the symbology ascribed to them, ‘ Mosquito ’ reflects its masked protagonist.

It’s unclear whether the protagonist’s name will be Mosquito, even if Mosquito turns out to be the final title of the movie, but it’s representative of the unique mask they wear and how it functions. Translated to English during the event, and in the midst of Miyamoto and Kojima frantically tiptoeing around spoiler territory, “the character has the ability to suck something,” and it’s not blood. As for what that could be, as well as what role this mysterious Mosquito character might play in the larger mythos, there are already several clues peppering the brief reveal teaser for Death Stranding Mosquito .

The Elephant in the Room is Mosquito’s Tar Mask

Like Sam, Mosquito’s protagonist is one of Death Stranding ’s repatriates. This is clear as the teaser begins with them submerging into the Seam, the vast body of water Sam is seen floating in whenever he dies in-game, and they repatriate by electing to return to the world of the living as the soul (ka) reenters the body (ha).

However, the protagonist’s repatriation process is quite remarkable as their ka is seen following the golden ‘strand’ to what is presumably their ha, though it’s difficult to tell from a distance, and, instead of doing what Sam does—gaining entry via the mouth and being met with a BB—the protagonist’s tar facial apparatus tentacle seems to be what enters, and what happens thereafter is unknown as the teaser cuts to a title card.

It’s clear the protagonist doesn’t require it in order to breathe, for instance, as it is removed to reveal their face during the fight and they don’t seem hindered. If it’s “sucking” something that isn’t blood, a decent bet would be that it harvests Death Stranding ’s chiralium. Otherwise, it’s anyone’s guess what it might be “sucking” from the protagonist’s own ha in the Seam. Perhaps they absorb their ha into their ka as they repatriate, sort of like an inverse of the usual repatriation process, in order to fuel their DOOMs, or potentially as a means of curing their chiral contamination or delivery dependence syndrome (DSS).

Death Stranding Mosquito’s Protagonist is Nothing Like the MULEs They May Be Affiliated With

Made evident by the suit they wear and the design of their odradek, Mosquito’s protagonist is one of Death Stranding ’s MULEs. This is an intriguing perspective to tell the story of Death Stranding Mosquito from, assuming that the animated movie dives a little deeper into MULEs overall, especially if the Mosquito-esque protagonist is a Homo gestalt who’s suffering prolonged exposure to chiral radiation.

Who is Death Stranding Mosquito’s Suspiciously Sam-Looking Bridges Porter?

Death Stranding Mosquito ’s reveal teaser cuts to a lengthy clip of the protagonist engaging in a cinematic and beautifully animated fight against a Bridges porter, who may or may not be Death Stranding ’s Sam Porter Bridges. This porter wears a blue Special Delivery Team (SDT) Bridges suit and even has the same ponytail hairstyle and facial hair that is as synonymous with Norman Reedus as it is with Sam. Of course, it isn’t wholly undeniable that it’s Sam, but the resemblance is probably deliberately striking regardless.

MULEs are porters’ natural antagonists, so it’s not inherently surprising that a MULE and a Bridges porter would be duking it out. What’s interesting is that the porter doesn’t appear to have any cargo; to be fair, a hilariously tall stack of meticulously organized containers and equipment could merely be out of frame and not seen during the fight scene.

Rather, the clip begins at 0:50 in the teaser with the protagonist protecting the dog BT from the porter, who tosses the BT aside before approaching it again, when he’s struck by the protagonist and sent hurtling backward in the craterous landscape. The protagonist seemingly has a BT pet, which conveniently resembles a dog and not one of the nightmarish Death Stranding BT types Sam has had to battle in seas of tar.

The fact that the protagonist then kneels to comfort and inspect the BT creature ensures that they are concerned for its well-being and protecting it. Death Stranding Mosquito ’s action is what fans would come to expect from a more traditional anime, to be sure, but it’s far from what players may expect a fight between a MULE and a Bridges porter to look like. Indeed, Death Stranding and Death Stranding 2: On the Beach ’s melee combat is considerably sluggish in comparison.

It’s impossible to deny that Sam, let alone any MULE or Bridges porter, could fight as stylishly and superhumanly once players are introduced to Death Stranding 2 ’s Pizza-Do karate techniques, even if the animated movie is as purposefully exaggerated as an anime.

The games emphasize stealth with Sam’s parry/bind strand maneuver more than actual fisticuffs, unless players decide to throw haymakers and dropkicks, and creative gunplay, whether lethal or non-lethal, over any other kind of action. That said, the games also don’t lean into action as heavily as they do exploration via route navigation and inventory management.

Perhaps Death Stranding Mosquito ’s action is merely intended to represent how adept the characters in the franchise’s world actually are at close-quarters combat and martial arts, while the games’ focal point and genre are much more leisurely and passive. Nonetheless, if this is truly Sam that the Mosquito character is sparring with, they may be able to kill each other and continuously repatriate, so it’ll be neat to see how their quarrel is resolved.

24
9.0 /10

Death Stranding 2: On the Beach

item.title: Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Players Are Not Happy With Shiny Legendary Event
item.description:
The shiny Koraidon and Miraidon distribution event for Pokemon Scarlet and Violet has not been a smooth one, as fans reported issues with GameStop running out of Mystery Gift code cards within a few hours. To make matters worse, some Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Mystery Gift cards from GameStop were being resold on eBay by scalpers.

On September 12, The Pokemon Company announced that shiny Koraidon and Miraidon would be available in a limited-time distribution event. This event is also the first time that the shiny variants of each Legendary Pokemon can legally be obtained. Shiny Koraidon is available for Pokemon Violet players, as is shiny Miraidon for Pokemon Scarlet trainers. The event is currently being conducted at various retailers in certain countries, including GameStop in the US, EB Games in Canada, Australia, and New Zealand, as well as approved retailers in Japan. In GameStop's case, printed cards containing Mystery Gift codes for use in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet will be distributed while supplies last.

Pokemon Fans Criticize How the Shiny Koraidon and Miraidon Event Has Been Handled

Although the shiny Koraidon and Miraidon Mystery Gift code event runs until October 15, a vast number of Pokemon Scarlet and Violet players have been unsuccessful in claiming a card code from GameStop. On the Pokemon Scarlet and Violet subreddit, fans claimed that various GameStop locations across the US had run out of Mystery Gift code cards within each store opening for the day. To make matters worse, some serial code cards for shiny Koraidon and Miraidon were being resold on eBay for various amounts, including a listing that started at $40. In response to the event, Pokemon fans stated that the event was not consumer-friendly for players who do not live near a GameStop. Others suggested that another method, such as a limited-time Tera Raid, would have been a preferable alternative that could prevent scalping.

The start of the shiny Koraidon and Miraidion event lined up with the release of the Pokemon TCG Mega Evolution expansion. This timing added to fans' concerns that scalpers would take advantage of the situation and line up at GameStop in advance. Some fans additionally suggested submitting a request to The Pokemon Company via its support website, with the intent of providing feedback on how the shiny Koraidon and Miraidon event has been handled so far.

As a silver lining, Pokemon Scarlet and Violet are currently hosting the Shiny Treasures of Ruin Mystery Gift event until September 30, which does not require a trip to GameStop to claim. Only time will tell if The Pokemon Company will address players' concerns about the shiny Koraidon and Miraidon event.

52
8.1 /10
6 /10

Pokemon Scarlet and Violet

Follow
Followed
RPG
Systems
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 71 /100 Critics Rec: 48%
Released
November 18, 2022
ESRB
E For Everyone Due To Mild Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
Game Freak
Publisher(s)
Nintendo, The Pokemon Company

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

The school that you’ve enrolled in as you play Pokémon Scarlet and Pokémon Violet hosts a special independent study project. The theme of this assignment is "A Treasure Hunt." Explore the world and seek out your very own treasure!

Three stories will be woven into your adventure while traversing the sprawling Paldea region. Along Victory Road, you will go to Gyms in different locations in order to to achieve Champion Rank. On the Path of Legends, you can join Arven in search of rare ingredients. And in ★ Starfall Street ★, you’ll challenge Team Star, a group of delinquents causing trouble for the school.

These stories are set in an open world, so where you go is all up to you. A world teeming with Pokémon and people to meet is waiting for you—traverse the Paldea region wherever you heart desires.

item.title: Roblox: Scrap It Codes (September 2025)
item.description:
Roblox can offer you many different experiences, and Scrap It is quite an interesting game. There, you will need to search for valuable items in the scrap yard and use them to earn money or craft special accessories. In order to increase your chances of finding better artifacts, you will have to purchase advanced scrap pickers and upgrade your character. All of these things cost a lot of money, and in this guide, we will tell you about Scrap It codes that can help you get some cash.

All Scrap It Codes

Working Scrap It Codes

  • RELEASE – Gives you x500 Cash.
  • 100LIKES!! – Gives you x1 Giftbox.

Expired Scap It Codes

Currently, there are no expired codes in Scrap It . If any of these coupons expire, we will update this section of the article and list them here.

In Scrap It , you will have to explore the scrap yard to find different items. This Roblox game allows you to improve your character in different ways, and promo codes can help you get some extra money for these upgrades. By redeeming them, you can obtain bonus cash or a Giftbox that contains random rewards.

We highly recommend that you redeem Scrap It codes as soon as possible. The rewards you can get with their help are very useful, but you won’t be able to claim them if these coupons expire.

How to Redeem Scrap It Codes

Coupons in Scrap It can provide you with useful bonuses, and if you want to get them, you will have to learn how to activate these Roblox codes. The redemption process is quite simple, and you can claim your rewards right at the beginning of your playthrough. Follow these steps to use Scrap It codes:

  • Join the Scrap It Roblox community.
  • Launch Scrap It and wait for this Roblox experience to load.
  • Once it’s loaded, click on the bird icon on the left side of the screen.
  • Enter the code you want to redeem in the menu that pops up.
  • Click on the Confirm button.
  • The reward is yours.

How to Get New Scrap It Codes

The developers may add new Scrap It promo codes in the future, and if they do, we will update our guide. You can bookmark this article and check it from time to time for new rewards. Also, you can follow the official media related to Scrap It :

  • X Account
  • YouTube Channel
  • Discord Server
Roblox

item.title: Open-World Games With The Fastest Movement
item.description:
Summary

  • Most open-world games use basic travel; a few reinvent movement with supernatural abilities or powerful gadgets that allow players to move really fast.
  • Infamous Second Son , Saints Row 4 , Prototype 2 , and Forspoken enable blistering speed in the open world via supernatural abilities.
  • Marvel's Spider-Man 2 and Just Cause 3 use advanced gadgets and special suits to shape exploration differently.

Despite having huge maps available for exploration, the majority of open-world games don't reinvent the wheel when it comes to fast player movement or unusual traversal mechanics. Aside from walking, running, and occasional climbing, some games may feature horseback riding or various vehicles to speed things up, but that's about it.

Fortunately, there are a few open-world games that offer far more creative ways to move around their vast worlds quickly, often without the need for high-speed vehicles. Primarily relying on supernatural abilities, extreme gadgets, or a mix of the two, the open-world games below feature some of the fastest movement in the genre, so let's take a closer look.

Marvel's Spider-Man 2

Web-Swinging and High-Speed Gliding

Marvel's Spider-Man 2
9 /10
51
8.9 /10
Released
October 20, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Drug Reference, Mild Language, Violence
Powered by

Marvel's Spider-Man 2 significantly expanded on the already excellent web-swinging mechanics from the original game and Spider-Man: Miles Morales , while also adding wingsuits to both playable characters, Peter and Miles. Using wingsuits allows players to cross the vast map of New York City in minutes, if not seconds, and can be very useful during specific chase sections in the sequel.

However, by adding wingsuits with little to no restrictions, the devs might have unintentionally made Marvel's Spider-Man 2's traversal overly fast, with some players even recommending not using them too much. Instead, leaning more toward classic web-swinging makes traversal more enjoyable, thanks to its fluid animations and numerous ways to interact with the surroundings while exploring the map.

Just Cause 3

A Classy Grappling Hook and Wingsuit Combo for Fast Traversal

Just Cause 3
8 /10
8.0 /10
Released
November 30, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

Probably the most beloved entry in the action-packed open-world series, Just Cause 3 brought the mayhem to never-before-seen levels while also significantly expanding players' possibilities for fast traversal. Rico Rodriguez can use vehicles to get around quickly, but there's almost no need to do so thanks to his combination of grappling hook and wingsuit.

By mastering movement in Just Cause 3 , players can move almost like Spider-Man, never touching the ground, and utilize the hook and wings for fast and convenient navigation around the world. The protagonist can even grapple toward moving cars, planes, and helicopters for some insane moves. Even today, few open-worlds can compare to the flexibility and speed of movement in both Just Cause 3 and Just Cause 4 .

Sunset Overdrive

Dynamic Movement Based on Grinding, Jumping, and Wall Running

Sunset Overdrive
8 /10
8.0 /10
Released
October 28, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Drug Reference, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

To this day, Sunset Overdrive features one of the most unique traversal systems in any open-world game, despite entirely lacking vehicles. Instead, players are encouraged to use “grinding” — fast sliding moves on almost any surface around the city, combining this core mechanic with other special moves like zipping, wall running, or using various city elements as trampolines.

What's special about Sunset Overdrive's traversal is that it's very skill-based, so players must actively learn how to master each move to breeze through environments with maximum efficiency, rather than just pressing a single button. Even water is used creatively, as players can briefly slide on its surface or perform dives and high rises to quickly gain speed and momentum.

Infamous Second Son

Smoke and Neon Superpowers Enhance Movement

inFAMOUS Second Son
8 /10
8.4 /10
Released
March 21, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Blood, Drug Reference, Language, Sexual Themes, Violence
Powered by

While not as fast as in Insomniac's Spider-Man games and not as unique as Sunset Overdrive , Infamous Second Son's traversal stands somewhere in between, offering a creative mix of superhero abilities to enhance and speed up the protagonist's movement. In addition to the parkour moves from previous entries, Delsin Rowe can use Smoke and Neon superpowers to navigate Seattle with speed and style.

From supernatural sprints, jumps, and glides to using environmental features like ventilation systems to quickly rise to rooftops, Infamous Second Son's traversal also benefits from stunning visuals during every move, allowing for breathtaking and fluid combinations in the air.

Saints Row 4

Supernatural Jump, Sprint, and Even Flying

Saints Row 4
8 /10
7.4 /10
Released
August 20, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Starting with Saints Row 3 , the series began to lean into the supernatural, with this aspect peaking in Saints Row 4 — arguably the most popular game in the series. To fuel its extremely unrealistic nature, Saints Row 4 is primarily set in a simulation, where players gain overpowered supernatural abilities and twisted weapons to conquer the virtual version of Steelport.

The array of superhero perks is fairly standard in Saints Row 4 , combining blazing-fast sprinting and gliding with super jumps, and even granting flight at certain points in the game. Notably, it remains one of the rare open-world games that allows unrestricted flying around the map rather than some variation of prolonged gliding.

Prototype 2

High-Speed and Fluid Jumping, Sprinting and Gliding

Prototype 2
7 /10
8.0 /10
Released
April 24, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature - Blood and Gore, Drug Reference, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language
Powered by

Prototype 2 builds on the already robust mutant-fueled traversal from the first game, playing somewhat similarly to Saints Row 4 . The protagonist can use superhero-like parkour moves to cross New York City in seconds, relying on high-speed sprinting, jumping, and gliding.

With that in mind, there are very few controllable vehicles available to players, as they are simply redundant, unable to move as fast as the character himself. While the movement in Prototype 2 is very fast and fluid, it lacks the creativity of some other games and is too easy to perform automatically, as the developers seemingly shifted the focus toward unstoppable action.

Forspoken

Fast-Paced Magic Parkour Full of Spectacular Acrobatics

Forspoken
6 /10
6.0 /10
Released
January 24, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Forspoken might not be the most well-received open-world game of recent times, yet there is plenty of originality in its combat and traversal systems, designed to feel unlike any other game. Fueled by diverse and spectacular magic abilities, Frey can move across Athia at high speed, utilizing flow-based moves with a touch of magic for lengthy jumps, zip grapples, unrestricted dashes, occasional mid-air floating, and even gliding across water.

Despite its vast map and the absence of vehicles or mounts, there are no obstacles capable of stopping players from high-speed “Magic Parkour” in Forspoken once all traversal abilities are mastered. The navigation system offers plenty of potential to combine acrobatics with more complex maneuvers as players see fit, unleashing quick and spectacular ways to move and fight in the open world.
